title: Ebiokpobo
author: Ebiokpobo
content: Hello everyone,It's been a week now since I eventually create my account on this forum but yet to understand anything at all and believe I have tried my best to read some of things or article but the whole site is a little confusing so I thought many seniors here could guide me and direct on what and how to go about everything.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Try using the search option; it might help you a lot to get some answers that you might want to ask but don't know where to ask them as they might have already been answered on previous threads.You can also do a quick preview of the forum rules in order to be in line and not fall victim to any rule violations. Just be original and stay organic; don't present other people's work like yours (plagiarism). Don't share information that you are not sure about, and always provide a source link to some information that you might want to share from another source.Try reading through the 3 pinned post on the first page of the beginners and help]

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: indeed it is confusing to fully understand how things work around here but if you take your time to read through the forum rules and some other stickled thread you’ll be able to figure out everything that you need to get started here.So here’s the link to the forum rules[1], make sure you go through it if you don’t what to get into any issue that will lead to your account being banned or suspended. It also explains the type of posts or threads that are accepted in each board, that will help you reduce the stress of having to click through several threads to learn it yourself. And just as the post above mine stated, don’t ever plagiarise. Even if you want to share just a single sentence make sure you add the source don’t play smart here as it will cost you your account. [1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on August 27, 2023, 02:43:36 PMHello everyone,It's been a week now since I eventually create my account on this forum but yet to understand anything at all and believe I have tried my best to read some of things or article but the whole site is a little confusing so I thought many seniors here could guide me and direct on what and how to go about everything.What’s your purpose when you register in forum? Focus on the board that tackle the topic that interests you because looking on all the available board will reall overwhelm you with different topic and discussion that you don’t have an idea.Go to your local board and ask for someone help on your specific question so that you will feel comfortable on discussion or go to Beginers & Help board and read tutorials and guides in there.  Determine what you really like and focus on that area first before you explore the forum.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on August 27, 2023, 02:43:36 PMHello everyone,It's been a week now since I eventually create my account on this forum but yet to understand anything at all and believe I have tried my best to read some of things or article but the whole site is a little confusing so I thought many seniors here could guide me and direct on what and how to go about everything.First of all, I wish to welcome you to the forum, and let you know that "bitcointalk" is not rocket science, that is hard for any individual not to understand. However, it's okay to get confused within the first week of your introduction to this new environment, because as time goes on, you are likely to get used to it and learn new things just as you just learned how to create a thread and post. For me, I call "bitcointalk" an encyclopedia of all any individual needs to know about Bitcoin, as it covers all aspects of Bitcoin (i.e. history of Bitcoin, learning of Bitcoin & discussion of Bitcoin-related topics), together with the ability to connect you with like-minded Bitcoin enthusiast all around the world.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: Okay, so I have been suggesting new users to search before posting but now, I would ask them to use Google Search using Dorks instead of Bitcointalk's own search feature.What is Google Dork?: Google dorking is a passive attack or hacking method involving the use of a custom query.Here are some examples of Google Dorking:- site:bitcointalk.org "username"- site:bitcointalk.org "topic title"Good Luck!

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: You cannot do everything at once. I have been here for the last 2 years and do not know a lot of things. I am learning day by day. All you have to understand about this forum is that it is a cryptocurrency-related discussion forum where you can share your opinions and learn from other people's topics.The best thing I like about this platform is that the content is so original and unique, which means there is no plagiarism. You could also share your insights about something, and if you do not understand anything in anyone's topic, you could ask them by making a reply. Or you could ask about that thing by making another topic, but it is not advised.Other than these learning things, we could also make some money on this forum, as there are many bounty, faucet, review, and signature companies, and by joining them, you could make some money too. But to do that, you are a long way behind.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on August 27, 2023, 02:43:36 PMHello everyone,It's been a week now since I eventually create my account on this forum but yet to understand anything at all and believe I have tried my best to read some of things or articles but the whole site is a little confusing so I thought many seniors here could guide me and direct on what and how to go about everything.It will take some time for you to fully understand how the forum works. That's why you don't need to rush to start posting because you need to learn how the forum works. If you are new in the Bitcoin space, you need to dedicate more time to learning about the coin so that you can make quality contributions to the forum. The forum has so much information that's why it has the search sections for you to get all the information you need. The forum has different boards that will interests you, visit those boards and ensure you read the rules. You can find the rules at the top of each board. If you put much effort, within a short time your knowledge about bitcoin and forum will improve. Welcome mate.

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: DYING_S0UL on August 27, 2023, 04:59:22 PMHere is the best place below for help and guides:You truly advise him to conduct a search   I mean with pictures. He is not that dumb. Well, still, you really make your point, and I was also going to suggest to the OP that he should use the search option, but the hurdle is that sometimes one does not know what he or she should search for in the search bar.Instead, they just type what is actually coming to their mind, and those things might not help them.The only advice I have for the OP is to first make up your mindset, e.g., why are you here, what do you want to search for, and what topic do you want to learn about?Many people just have the wrong mindset about this platform, like thinking it is a freelancing platform to make money. Let me correct or assure you that this is a forum just like any other forum, but this one is related to BTC and ATLs, and many other types of things are discussed here.You should learn the basics of BTC and ALTs first, how transactions are made, what exactly is blockchain, and how you can do that. You have to engage in many of the topics you see here. You should visit the following websites:Bitcoin Discussions:Beginners and HelpTrading DiscussionsEconomicsMetaetc. These threads will teach you enough, but if you are a technical person, there are many other sections available in the first Board of BTC discussion that you could join."

comments.body: You are welcome. Op all what you have to do is to read bitcoin materials inside and outside so you can comprehend what is going on here. comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on August 27, 2023, 02:43:36 PMHello everyone,It's been a week now since I eventually create my account on this forum but yet to understand anything at all and believe I have tried my best to read some of things or article but the whole site is a little confusing so I thought many seniors here could guide me and direct on what and how to go about everything.Hello Ebiokpobo!I can totally see how Bitcointalk might be a head-scratcher if you are new to online forums. Have you ever used Reddit, for example? It is kinda like that. You pick a board on the main page that interests you (the names are usually self-explanatory), then you check out the latest topics and dive into whatever catches your eye. If you are not interested in a topic, just go back and pick another.  If you are looking for something specific, you can use the built-in search tool or, as already suggested, give Google a shot. When you find a topic you wanna chime in on or ask about, hit up Reply or Quote. That is pretty much it - you will pick up the rest as you go. Don't hesitate to ask if there is anything you are still unsure about.
